title: heritable
text: key goal breeding trial calculate heritability, describes extent trait interest underpinned genetic variance. heritable one-stop shop heritability calculations R. , implemented existing methods heritability aid reproducible transparent reporting ’s calculations. vignette brief overview heritable’s workflow key features. heritable compatible model outputs asreml lme4 extracts relevant variance components calculate heritability single environment trials.

title: heritable
text: Note package active development. can install development version heritable GitHub :

title: heritable
text: Let’s work lettuce dataset contains phenotypic measurements downy mildew resistance score 89 lettuce genotypes across 3 locations (environments), 3 replicates.demonstration purposes, use subset single environment (loc == L2), displayed plot .  also access genomic relationship matrix (GRM) calculated 300 genetic markers use narrow-sense heritability.
code: library(dplyr) head(lettuce_phenotypes) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   loc   gen   rep       y #>   <fct> <fct> <fct> <dbl> #> 1 L1    G1    R1      2   #> 2 L1    G1    R2      2.5 #> 3 L1    G2    R1      1.5 #> 4 L1    G2    R2      2   #> 5 L1    G3    R1      1   #> 6 L1    G3    R2      2  lettuce_subset <- lettuce_phenotypes |>   filter(loc == "L2") # View the structure of the GRM dim(lettuce_GRM) #> [1] 89 89 lettuce_GRM[1:5, 1:5] #>     G1  G2  G3  G4  G5 #> G1 268   9  13  -3 -46 #> G2   9 270 -19 -50 104 #> G3  13 -19 250  21  -5 #> G4  -3 -50  21 281  21 #> G5 -46 104  -5  21 296

title: heritable
text: Broad-sense heritability represents ratio genetic variance phenotypic variance. Genetic variance incorporates additive, epistatic dominance effects. , provided code asreml lme4 fit model genotype random effect. Note heritability estimates data balanced. Use H2() wrapper compute broad-sense heritability. wrapper three key imputs model, lme4 asreml object target, name genotype/varietal/line variable model e.g. "gen" method, method H2 calculation want. default, methods computed. Alternatively want single method, can call method’s function directly. named H2_ prefix, followed method name. Learn method looking help file ?H2_Cullis
code: # Fit an asreml model with genotype as random effect library(asreml) lettuce_asreml <- asreml(   fixed = y ~ rep,   random = ~ gen,   data = lettuce_subset,   trace = FALSE )  # Fit an lme4 model with genotype as random effect library(lme4) lettuce_lme4 <- lmer(y ~ rep + (1 | gen), data = lettuce_subset) # Calculate broad-sense heritability using multiple methods H2(lettuce_asreml, target = "gen", method = c("Standard", "Cullis", "Oakey")) #> Error in eval(newcall, parent.frame()): object 'lettuce_subset' not found H2(lettuce_lme4, target = "gen", method = c("Standard", "Cullis", "Oakey")) #>  Standard    Cullis     Oakey  #> 0.8294971 0.8294971 0.8294971 H2_Cullis(lettuce_asreml, target = "gen") #> Error in eval(newcall, parent.frame()): object 'lettuce_subset' not found H2_Delta(lettuce_lme4, target = "gen") #> [1] 0.8294971

title: heritable
text: Depending heritable function, output vary: H2() wrappers return named vector method H2_Delta() return numeric value H2_Delta_by_genotype() return named list according target variable H2_Delta_pairwise() return symmetrical matrix pairwise combinations target interested comparing heritability values across multiple models methods, can leverage tidyverse functions wrangle output dataframe/tibble
code: library(purrr) library(tidyr)  tibble(   model = list(lettuce_lme4, lettuce_asreml) # Include model as a list variable   ) |>   mutate(H2 = map(model, # Apply the `H2()` function over each model object                   ~H2(.x, target = "gen", method = c("Standard", "Delta", "Oakey"))                   )          )|>   unnest_wider(H2) # Expand the output #> Error in `mutate()`: #> ℹ In argument: `H2 = map(...)`. #> Caused by error in `map()`: #> ℹ In index: 2. #> Caused by error: #> ! object 'lettuce_subset' not found

title: Authors and Citation
text: Fonti Kar. Author, maintainer. Emi Tanaka. Author, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kar F, Tanaka E (2025). heritable: R package heritability calculations plant breeding trials. R package version 0.0.9000, https://github.com/anu-aagi/heritable.
code: @Manual{,   title = {heritable: R package for heritability calculations for plant breeding trials},   author = {Fonti Kar and Emi Tanaka},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/anu-aagi/heritable}, }

title: Heritability Estimation From Mixed Models
text: heritable one-stop shop heritability calculations R. goal implement existing methods heritability aid reproducibility reporting ’s calculations.heritable works model outputs asreml lme4 support calculations broad narrow sense heritability variety method single environment breeding trials.

title: Heritability Estimation From Mixed Models
text: Note package active development. can install development version heritable GitHub :

title: Heritability Estimation From Mixed Models
text: basic example shows calculate broad-sense heritability single environment trial using asreml lme4. H2() function refers broad-sense heritability default, compute available heritability methods . Alteratively, help tidyverse functions, can return measures different models tibble.
code: library(heritable)    fit_asreml <- asreml::asreml(yield ~ rep,     random = ~ gen + rep:block,     data = agridat::john.alpha,     trace = FALSE   )  fit_lme4 <- lme4::lmer(yield ~ rep + (1|gen) + (1|rep:block),                        data = agridat::john.alpha) H2(fit_asreml, target = "gen") #>    Cullis     Oakey    Piepho     Delta  Standard  #> 0.8090841 0.8090841 0.8029760 0.8090841 0.8400648 H2(fit_lme4, target = "gen") #>    Cullis     Oakey    Piepho     Delta  Standard  #> 0.8091338 0.8091338 0.7966375 0.8091338 0.8400678 library(tidyverse) tibble(model = list(fit_lme4, fit_asreml)) |>    mutate(H2 = map(model, ~H2(.x, target = "gen"))) |>    unnest_wider(H2) #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   model     Cullis Oakey Piepho Delta Standard #>   <list>     <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 <lmerMod>  0.809 0.809  0.797 0.809    0.840 #> 2 <asreml>   0.809 0.809  0.803 0.809    0.840

title: Heritability Estimation From Mixed Models
code: citation("heritable") #> To cite package 'heritable' in publications use: #>  #>   Kar F, Deng Y, Tanaka E (2025). _heritable: R package for #>   heritability calculations for plant breeding trials_. R package #>   version 0.0.9000, <https://github.com/anu-aagi/heritable>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {heritable: R package for heritability calculations for plant breeding trials}, #>     author = {Fonti Kar and Yidi Deng and Emi Tanaka}, #>     year = {2025}, #>     note = {R package version 0.0.9000}, #>     url = {https://github.com/anu-aagi/heritable}, #>   }

what: Found a bug? Want to contribute?
title: Heritability Estimation From Mixed Models
text: welcome feedback contributions shapes sizes! Take look existing backlog add relevant discussion lodge new issue.

what: Calculate Cullis' heritability from model object — H2_Cullis
title: Calculate Cullis' heritability from model object — H2_Cullis
text: Compute "generalised heritability" unbalanced experimental designs. See Cullis, Smith Coombes (2006) derivation.

title: Calculate Cullis' heritability from model object — H2_Cullis
Calculate Cullis' heritability from model object — H2_Cullis
text: model Model object class lmerMod/merMod asreml target name random effect heritability calculated. options NULL default, internal checking model object calculations

title: Calculate Cullis' heritability from model object — H2_Cullis
text: Numeric value

title: Calculate Cullis' heritability from model object — H2_Cullis
text: equation Cullis heritability follow $$H^2_{Cullis} = 1 - \frac{PEV^{BLUP}_{\overline\Delta ij}}{2\sigma^2_g}$$ : \(PEV\) prediction error variance matrix pairwise differences among BLUPS \(\sigma^2\) variance attributed differences genotype

title: Calculate Cullis' heritability from model object — H2_Cullis
text: Cullis, B. R., Smith, . B., & Coombes, N. E. (2006). design early generation variety trials correlated data. Journal Agricultural, Biological, Environmental Statistics, 11(4), 381–393. https://doi.org/10.1198/108571106X154443

what: Calculate Cullis heritability using variance parameters — H2_Cullis_parameters
title: Calculate Cullis heritability using variance parameters — H2_Cullis_parameters
text: Compute Cullis heritability genotype means using average variance pairwise differences best linear unbiased predictors (BLUPs).

title: Calculate Cullis heritability using variance parameters — H2_Cullis_parameters
Calculate Cullis heritability using variance parameters — H2_Cullis_parameters
text: vd_BLUP_avg Numeric. Average variance pairwise differences among BLUPs vc_g Numeric. Genotype variance component

title: Calculate Cullis heritability using variance parameters — H2_Cullis_parameters
text: Single numeric value

title: Calculate Cullis heritability using variance parameters — H2_Cullis_parameters
text: equation Cullis heritability follow $$H^2_{Cullis} = 1 - \frac{PEV^{BLUP}_{\overline\Delta ij}}{2\sigma^2_g}$$ : \(PEV\) prediction error variance matrix pairwise differences among BLUPS \(\sigma^2\) variance attributed differences genotype

title: Calculate Cullis heritability using variance parameters — H2_Cullis_parameters
text: Cullis, B. R., Smith, . B., & Coombes, N. E. (2006). design early generation variety trials correlated data. Journal Agricultural, Biological, Environmental Statistics, 11(4), 381–393. https://doi.org/10.1198/108571106X154443

title: Calculate Cullis heritability using variance parameters — H2_Cullis_parameters

what: Calculate average heritability of differences between genotypes from model object — H2_Delta
title: Calculate average heritability of differences between genotypes from model object — H2_Delta
text: Instead computing heritability "entry-mean" basis, method calculates heritability using "entry-differences". Entry referring genotype, line variety interest. See reference origin interpretation H2_Delta variants

title: Calculate average heritability of differences between genotypes from model object — H2_Delta
code: H2_Delta(model,          target,          type = c("BLUP", "BLUE"),          aggregate = c("arithmetic", "harmonic"),          options          )

title: Calculate average heritability of differences between genotypes from model object — H2_Delta
text: model Model object class lmerMod/merMod asreml target name random effect heritability calculated. type character, whether heritability calculated using BLUEs BLUPs aggregate character, taking means calculation, harmonic arithmetic mean used? options NULL default, internal checking model object calculations

title: Calculate average heritability of differences between genotypes from model object — H2_Delta
text: Numeric

title: Calculate average heritability of differences between genotypes from model object — H2_Delta
text: heritability differences genotypes given : $$H^2_{\Delta ..} = 1 - \frac{PEV^{BLUP}_{\overline\Delta ..}}{2\sigma^2_g}$$ : \(PEV^{BLUP}_{\overline\Delta ..}\) mean prediction error variance matrix pairwise differences among BLUPs (BLUEs method = "BLUE") across genotypes \(\sigma^2\) variance attributed differences genotype See reference page 995 - 997 full derivation heritability measure related variants

title: Calculate average heritability of differences between genotypes from model object — H2_Delta
text: Schmidt, P., Hartung, J., Rath, J., & Piepho, H.-P. (2019). Estimating Broad-Sense Heritability Unbalanced Data Agricultural Cultivar Trials. Crop Science, 59(2), 525–536. https://doi.org/10.2135/cropsci2018.06.0376

title: Calculate average heritability of differences between genotypes from model object — H2_Delta
code: # lme4 model lettuce_lme4 <- lme4::lmer(y ~ rep + (1 | gen), data = lettuce_subset) #> Error: bad 'data': object 'lettuce_subset' not found H2_Delta(lettuce_lme4, target = "gen") #> Error: object 'lettuce_lme4' not found  # asreml model (Requires license) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ lettuce_asreml <- asreml::asreml(fixed = y ~ rep,                                  random = ~ gen,                                  data = lettuce_subset,                                  trace = FALSE                                  )  H2_Delta(lettuce_asreml, target = "gen") } # }

what: Calculate heritability of pairwise differences using variance parameters — H2_Delta_BLUP_parameters
title: Calculate heritability of pairwise differences using variance parameters — H2_Delta_BLUP_parameters
text: Compute broad-sense heritability differences using variance differences two BLUPs/BLUEs

title: Calculate heritability of pairwise differences using variance parameters — H2_Delta_BLUP_parameters

title: Calculate heritability of differences for a given genotype from model object — H2_Delta_by_genotype
text: Instead computing heritability "entry-mean" basis, method calculates heritability using "entry-differences". Entry referring genotype, line variety interest. See reference origin interpretation h2/H2_Delta_by_genotype variants

title: Calculate heritability of differences for a given genotype from model object — H2_Delta_by_genotype
Calculate heritability of differences for a given genotype from model object — H2_Delta_by_genotype
text: model Model object class lmerMod/merMod asreml target name random effect heritability calculated. type character, whether heritability calculated using BLUEs BLUPs options NULL default, internal checking model object calculations

title: Calculate heritability of differences for a given genotype from model object — H2_Delta_by_genotype
text: Numeric Named list, element containing named numeric vector

title: Calculate heritability of differences for a given genotype from model object — H2_Delta_by_genotype
text: heritability differences given genotype given : $$H^2_{\Delta .} = 1 - \frac{PEV^{BLUP}_{\overline\Delta .}}{2\sigma^2_g}$$ : \(PEV^{BLUP}_{\overline\Delta .}\) arithmetic mean prediction error variance matrix pairwise differences among BLUPs (BLUEs method = "BLUE") given genotype \(\sigma^2\) variance attributed differences genotype See reference page 995 - 997 full derivation heritability measure related variants

title: Calculate heritability of differences for a given genotype from model object — H2_Delta_by_genotype
text: Schmidt, P., Hartung, J., Rath, J., & Piepho, H.-P. (2019). Estimating Broad-Sense Heritability Unbalanced Data Agricultural Cultivar Trials. Crop Science, 59(2), 525–536. https://doi.org/10.2135/cropsci2018.06.0376

title: Calculate heritability of differences for a given genotype from model object — H2_Delta_by_genotype
code: # lme4 model lettuce_lme4 <- lme4::lmer(y ~ rep + (1 | gen), data = lettuce_subset) #> Error: bad 'data': object 'lettuce_subset' not found H2_Delta_by_genotype(lettuce_lme4, target = "gen") #> Error: object 'lettuce_lme4' not found  # asreml model (Requires license) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ lettuce_asreml <- asreml::asreml(fixed = y ~ rep,                                  random = ~ gen,                                  data = lettuce_subset,                                  trace = FALSE                                  )  H2_Delta_by_genotype(lettuce_asreml, target = "gen") } # }

what: Calculate Oakey's heritability from model object — H2_Oakey
title: Calculate Oakey's heritability from model object — H2_Oakey
text: Compute heritability genotype means using variance–covariance matrix genotype BLUPs described Oakey et al. (2006).

title: Calculate Oakey's heritability from model object — H2_Oakey
Calculate Oakey's heritability from model object — H2_Oakey
text: model Model object class lmerMod/merMod asreml target name random effect heritability calculated. options NULL default, internal checking model object calculations

title: Calculate Oakey's heritability from model object — H2_Oakey
text: Numeric

title: Calculate Oakey's heritability from model object — H2_Oakey
text: $$H^2_{Oakey} = \frac{\sum_{= n_z+1}^{n_g} \lambda_i}{\sum_{n_g}^{\lambda_i\neq 0}}$$ : \(n_g\) number genotypes \(n_z\) number zero eigenvalues \(\lambda_i\) ith eigenvalue matrix \(I_{m} - G^{-1}C^{gg}\) \(\sigma^2\) variance attributed differences genotype See pages 813 818 reference full derivation explanation Oakey's heritability

title: Calculate Oakey's heritability from model object — H2_Oakey
text: Oakey, H., Verbyla, ., Pitchford, W., Cullis, B., & Kuchel, H. (2006). Joint modeling additive non-additive genetic line effects single field trials. Theoretical Applied Genetics, 113(5), 809–819. https://doi.org/10.1007/s00122-006-0333-z

title: Calculate Oakey's heritability from model object — H2_Oakey
code: # lme4 model lettuce_lme4 <- lme4::lmer(y ~ rep + (1 | gen), data = lettuce_subset) #> Error: bad 'data': object 'lettuce_subset' not found H2_Oakey(lettuce_lme4, target = "gen") #> Error: object 'lettuce_lme4' not found  # asreml model (Requires license) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ lettuce_asreml <- asreml::asreml(fixed = y ~ rep,                                  random = ~ gen,                                  data = lettuce_subset,                                  trace = FALSE                                  )  H2_Oakey(lettuce_asreml, target = "gen") } # }

Calculate Piepho's heritability from model object Compute Piepho's heritability using variance differences between genotype BLUEs — H2_Piepho
text: model Model object class lmerMod/merMod asreml target name random effect heritability calculated. options NULL default, internal checking model object calculations

title: Calculate Piepho's heritability from model object Compute Piepho's heritability using variance differences between genotype BLUEs — H2_Piepho
text: equation Piepho's heritability follows: $$H^2_{Piepho} = \frac{\sigma^2_g}{\sigma^2_g + \overline{PEV_{BLUE_g}} / 2}$$ : \(\overline{PEV_{BLUE_g}}\) prediction error variance matrix genotype BLUEs \(\sigma^2_g\) variance attributed differences genotype See reference full derivation details.

title: Calculate Piepho's heritability from model object Compute Piepho's heritability using variance differences between genotype BLUEs — H2_Piepho
text: Piepho, H.-P., & Möhring, J. (2007). Computing Heritability Selection Response Unbalanced Plant Breeding Trials. Genetics, 177(3), 1881–1888. https://doi.org/10.1534/genetics.107.074229

title: Calculate Piepho's heritability from model object Compute Piepho's heritability using variance differences between genotype BLUEs — H2_Piepho
code: # lme4 model lettuce_lme4 <- lme4::lmer(y ~ rep + (1 | gen), data = lettuce_subset) #> Error: bad 'data': object 'lettuce_subset' not found H2_Piepho(lettuce_lme4, target = "gen") #> Error: object 'lettuce_lme4' not found  # asreml model (Requires license) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ lettuce_asreml <- asreml::asreml(fixed = y ~ rep,                                  random = ~ gen,                                  data = lettuce_subset,                                  trace = FALSE                                  )  H2_Piepho(lettuce_asreml, target = "gen") } # }

what: Calculate standard heritability from model object — H2_Standard
title: Calculate standard heritability from model object — H2_Standard
text: Compute standard heritability using classic ratio method genotypic phenotypic variance. See Falconer & Mackay (1996)

title: Calculate standard heritability from model object — H2_Standard
Calculate standard heritability from model object — H2_Standard
text: model Model object class lmerMod/merMod asreml target name random effect heritability calculated. options NULL default, internal checking model object calculations

title: Calculate standard heritability from model object — H2_Standard
text: Numeric value

title: Calculate standard heritability from model object — H2_Standard
text: equation used calculate standard heritability : $$H^2_{Standard} = \frac{\sigma^2_g}{\sigma^2_g + \frac{1}{n_g}\sum_{n_g}^{=1} \sigma^2_p / n_{gi}}$$ : \(n_g\) number genotypes \(n_{gi}\) number replicate given genotype \(\sigma_g\) variance attributed genotype differences \(\sigma_p\) variance attributed phenotypic differences

title: Calculate standard heritability from model object — H2_Standard
text: Falconer, D. S., & Mackay, T. F. C. (1996). Introduction quantitative genetics (4th ed.). Longman.

title: Calculate standard heritability from model object — H2_Standard
code: # lme4 model lettuce_lme4 <- lme4::lmer(y ~ rep + (1 | gen), data = lettuce_subset) #> Error: bad 'data': object 'lettuce_subset' not found H2_Standard(lettuce_lme4, target = "gen") #> Error: object 'lettuce_lme4' not found  # asreml model (Requires license) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ lettuce_asreml <- asreml::asreml(fixed = y ~ rep,                                  random = ~ gen,                                  data = lettuce_subset,                                  trace = FALSE                                  )  H2_Standard(lettuce_asreml, target = "gen") } # }

title: Fit the counterpart of an asreml model by swapping a specified term between fixed and random — fit_counterpart_model.asreml
text: Fit "counterpart" model existing asreml model moving specified term random effects fixed effects vice versa. useful procedures require term fitted opposite effect (example, calculating Piepho's heritability).

title: Fit the counterpart of an asreml model by swapping a specified term between fixed and random — fit_counterpart_model.asreml
code: # S3 method for class 'asreml' fit_counterpart_model(model, target = NULL)

title: Fit the counterpart of an asreml model by swapping a specified term between fixed and random — fit_counterpart_model.asreml
text: model existing fitted asreml model object. function expects formulas can retrieved via formula(model)$fixed formula(model)$random model frame available model$mf. target Character(1). Name term (e.g. factor variable) switched fixed random effects. Must match one terms present either model's fixed random formulas.

title: Fit the counterpart of an asreml model by swapping a specified term between fixed and random — fit_counterpart_model.asreml
text: fitted asreml model object identical input model except target moved random effects fixed effects fixed effects random effects, depending appeared original model. returned object produced asreml::asreml can used subsequent model comparisons variance-component calculations.

what: Calculate heritability from mixed model object — H2
title: Calculate heritability from mixed model object — H2
text: case-specific wrapper calculating heritability. upper case prefix H2_ refers wrapper subfunctions e.g. H2_Delta() calculating broad sense heritability

title: Calculate heritability from mixed model object — H2
Calculate heritability from mixed model object — H2
text: model Model object class lmerMod/merMod asreml target name random effect heritability calculated. method Character vector name method calculate heritability. See details. options NULL default, internal checking model object calculations

title: Calculate heritability from mixed model object — H2
text: named numeric vector, length matching number methods supplied

title: Calculate heritability from mixed model object — H2
text: following methods currently implemented broad-sense heritability H2(method = "XX"): "Cullis": $$H^2_{Cullis} = 1 - \frac{PEV^{BLUP}_{\overline\Delta ij}}{2\sigma^2_g}$$ "Oakey": $$H^2_{Oakey} = \frac{\sum_{= n_z+1}^{n_g} \lambda_i}{\sum_{n_g}^{\lambda_i\neq 0}}$$ "Delta": $$H^2_{\Delta ..} = 1 - \frac{PEV^{BLUP}_{\overline\Delta ..}}{2\sigma^2_g}$$ "Piepho": $$H^2_{Piepho} = \frac{\sigma^2_g}{\sigma^2_g + \overline{PEV_{BLUE_g}} / 2}$$ "Standard": $$H^2_{Standard} = \frac{\sigma^2_g}{\sigma^2_g + \frac{1}{n_g}\sum_{n_g}^{=1} \sigma^2_p / n_{gi}}$$ details specific method - take look help file subfunctions ?H2_Cullis

title: Calculate heritability from mixed model object — H2
text: Cullis, B. R., Smith, . B., & Coombes, N. E. (2006). design early generation variety trials correlated data. Journal Agricultural, Biological, Environmental Statistics, 11(4), 381–393. https://doi.org/10.1198/108571106X154443 Oakey, H., Verbyla, ., Pitchford, W., Cullis, B., & Kuchel, H. (2006). Joint modeling additive non-additive genetic line effects single field trials. Theoretical Applied Genetics, 113(5), 809–819. https://doi.org/10.1007/s00122-006-0333-z Schmidt, P., Hartung, J., Rath, J., & Piepho, H.-P. (2019). Estimating Broad-Sense Heritability Unbalanced Data Agricultural Cultivar Trials. Crop Science, 59(2), 525–536. https://doi.org/10.2135/cropsci2018.06.0376 Piepho, H.-P., & Möhring, J. (2007). Computing Heritability Selection Response Unbalanced Plant Breeding Trials. Genetics, 177(3), 1881–1888. https://doi.org/10.1534/genetics.107.074229 Falconer, D. S., & Mackay, T. F. C. (1996). Introduction quantitative genetics (4th ed.). Longman.

title: Calculate heritability from mixed model object — H2
code: # lme4 model lettuce_lme4 <- lme4::lmer(y ~ rep + (1 | gen), data = lettuce_subset) #> Error: bad 'data': object 'lettuce_subset' not found H2(lettuce_lme4, target = "gen", method = c("Standard", "Delta")) #> Error: object 'lettuce_lme4' not found  # asreml model (Requires license) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ lettuce_asreml <- asreml::asreml(fixed = y ~ rep,                                  random = ~ gen,                                  data = lettuce_subset,                                  trace = FALSE                                  )  H2(lettuce_asreml, target = "gen", method = c("Standard", "Delta")) } # }
